articles.title: Extreme weather in Huelva: 'I haven't seen conditions this extreme in more than 30 years'
articles.summary: Severe rain and wind in February 2026 are causing major damage to Huelva strawberry and raspberry plots. Limited availability is keeping prices high but fruit quality is impacted. Northern Morocco is also flooded, reducing competing supply to European markets.

articles.title: Despite the phenological delay, Huelva starts strawberry harvest with good market forecasts
articles.summary: The first strawberries of the 2025/2026 season are appearing in Lepe, Huelva, after overcoming weather challenges including high temperatures during sowing and storm Claudia. The season began with high technical demands but marketing expectations remain optimistic with good demand across all potential markets.

articles.title: Egyptian strawberry acreage increased, but yield per hectare declined
articles.summary: From January 2026, Egyptian strawberries face tighter EU border controls with 20% of shipments physically inspected for pesticide residues. Compliant frozen strawberry volumes are approaching sold-out levels early in the season. Key export destinations include Germany, Poland and the Netherlands.

articles.title: Frost slashes 2025 cherry harvests in Europe and Turkey
articles.summary: April 2025 frosts caused devastating losses: Turkey lost 50-70% of its cherry crop after temperatures dropped to -15°C. Poland lost 50-55% of sour cherries. Hungary saw 80-90% losses in sweet cherries. Romania lost 70-80%. A critical reminder of the importance of frost monitoring during flowering.

articles.title: Serbia's frozen raspberry exports hit by low yields and disease
articles.summary: Serbia faces a 20-30% yield drop in 2025 due to spring frosts, drought, and viral disease in the Arilje region. European frozen raspberry prices reached €4.6/kg but supply is scarce. Ukraine is positioning to become the global leader in frozen raspberry exports by volume in 2025/26.

articles.title: Serbian raspberry production hit by weather — output may fall to 10,000 tons
articles.summary: Serbia's raspberry output may reach only 10,000-15,000 tons this season after drought, freezing in April, and 48 days without rain in Macva. Empty refrigeration facilities and rising prices at Zlatibor stock markets signal a very tight supply season ahead for European processors.

articles.title: Ukrainian berry producers explore raspberry freezing technologies in Serbia
articles.summary: In December 2025, Ukrainian berry growers and processors toured Serbia to study raspberry freezing and processing technology. The Ukrainian Berry Association is working to improve competitiveness as Ukraine positions itself to become a top frozen raspberry exporter in 2025/26.

articles.title: Chile forecasts modest increase in blueberry exports in the 2025-2026 season
articles.summary: Frutas de Chile projects a 1% rise in fresh blueberry shipments for 2025-26, with frozen blueberry exports forecast to exceed 161,000 tons — a record 43% of total shipments. Protected varieties will account for 35% of exports. Continental Europe receives 41% of Chilean blueberry exports.

articles.title: Chile's blueberry exports reach 55,946 tons with 12% organic share
articles.summary: Chile exported 55,946 tons of blueberries in the 2024/25 season — a 7% increase from prior year. Continental Europe is the primary market at 41%, followed by the USA at 35%. New and recommended varieties now account for 81% of shipments, with Legacy the leading variety at 45%.

articles.title: More demand for Turkish strawberries this season
articles.summary: Turkish strawberry production is higher this season with growing export demand. Growers in the Mersin and Adana coastal belt report a strong start to the 2024/25 campaign, with European buyers showing increased interest in Turkish supply as an alternative to Spanish and Egyptian product.

articles.title: Global market overview: Cherries 2025
articles.summary: The 2025 cherry season saw highly variable conditions across Europe and Turkey. Turkey had severe frost losses of 50-70%. Germany's domestic cherries gained market share. Italy had one of its best seasons in the north. A comprehensive review of sweet and sour cherry market dynamics globally.

articles.title: Huelva's strawberry and raspberry supply not enough to meet all orders
articles.summary: Bad weather reduced Huelva strawberry and raspberry supply by 10-15% below the previous season in March 2025. France and Germany, where demand is highest, faced shortages. This highlights the weather vulnerability of Europe's most important berry-producing province and the need for supply diversification.
